TopicTitle: What do you have as your screensaver?

Articles.Content: My last one was a photo of Mars but I am looking to change it up. Just looking for inspiration.

I have two of them.

1. 30 min delay before display is off.

2. A power button on the monitor as a night mode.
The last time I had a screensaver was when I still had a CRT. With an LCD monitor they're nothing but a power-wasting device.

I don't think I've used a screensaver in over a decade.

 I think my work computer locks after a certain time and blanks the screen.

 

Are screensavers still a thing?  Where's the old Star Trek one I used to use?

 

 

 

Oh, here it is.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8gw9FhPuCk7SjsalkYY4imKYxiFARwY1

Edited August 14, 2020 by razark
A slideshow of old Space Engine screeshots. It's so inoffensive I've even added it to my work laptop now.
It says "No Input Detected" and some red, green, and blue bars, then turns off.

Did you mean desktop wallpaper?  I see the terms interchanged quite a bit.

If that's the case, I have one of the pictures I took of Discovery last year on the computer I'm currently on.
A screenshot from my first planet pack, Hythara Planet Pack, from a moon.

Oh, forgot it.

I have "Space Dust" screensaver.

It's visible on the blank black screen (the space) until I clean it.

Mine does a slideshow for a while before the monitor sleeps.

On 8/13/2020 at 10:59 PM, steve_v said:

 The last time I had a screensaver was when I still had a CRT. With an LCD monitor they're nothing but a power-wasting device.

I figure with the huge screen occupying visual area, it might as well become a digital frame and show images, so I have mine slideshow.

I believe, when e-paper or e-glass get enough cheap to stick them on walls and long-use furniture, there will begin the era of unified customizable low-cost social housing for the unemployed (due to automation) majority living from the universal citizen's income.

Then screensavers will be on every wall to let the pauper feel like a prince. A hippie's paradise.
